item.title: Comment on Friday assorted links by Smithers
item.description:
2) Funny how all these euphemisms like "unhoused," "marginalized," etc. are not really nouns but action verbs that imply someone or something is responsible for imposing that status on them.

item.title: Comment on Claude read the Chevron pdf by The Scary Black Hundreder
item.description:
Reply to DGS:

Limiting the power of the administrative state is a good thing. Less regulation is a good thing. It’s been a long time coming…too long.

Under Claude's interpretation, the administrative state is replaced with the judicial state, which is also an unaccountable and politicized permanent bureaucracy. May a trillion Hawaiian judges reign!

Comment URL: https://marginalrevolution.com/marginalrevolution/2024/06/claude-read-the-chevron-pdf.html?commentID=160774631

Post URL: https://marginalrevolution.com/marginalrevolution/2024/06/claude-read-the-chevron-pdf.html?utm_source=rss&utm_medium=rss&utm_campaign=claude-read-the-chevron-pdf

item.title: Comment on Claude read the Chevron pdf by Jimmy
item.description:
Reply to The Scary Black Hundreder:

Under Claude's interpretation, the administrative state is replaced with the judicial state, which is also an unaccountable and politicized permanent bureaucracy. May a trillion Hawaiian judges reign!

Well, Congress could always draft laws that can be clearly promulgated instead of writing deliberately broad language that delegates their power to either of those branches and relieves them of responsibility for making decisions.

Comment URL: https://marginalrevolution.com/marginalrevolution/2024/06/claude-read-the-chevron-pdf.html?commentID=160774666
